description: The Eastern Redbud (Cercis Canadensis 'Covey') is a wonderful medium-sized tree that deserves a place in any garden. It has a rounded canopy and a smooth, grey bark. The stem and branches are an attractive cinnamon brown. In spring it produces masses of bright pink flowers, giving an amazing burst of colour. The foliage is an elegant dark green in summer and turns to a stunning red in autumn. It can tolerate most soil types and is very easy to maintain with minimal pruning. With its attractive shape and low maintenance, the Eastern Redbud is an incredible addition to any garden.
